navbar.logoAlt: Logo - Open book, with waves on the pages and an aqueduct in the background

home.credits: The project, promoted by Roma Capitale - Assessorato alla Cultura, is the winner of the Public Notice Artes et Iubilaeum - 2025, financed by the European Union Next Generation EU for major tourism events within the framework of the PNRR on measure M1C3 - Investment 4.3 - Caput Mundi
home.title: The Tale of Water
home.paragraph1: The proposal conceived by the Association Ciel'in Città focuses on the theme of water, source of cultural, spiritual and social inspiration of the city of Rome. With the collaboration of many qualified professionals, the interventions will mainly concern Municipalities VII and V, territories rich in cultural testimonies and social significance, and include: a day of studies and an opera/ homage to Don Roberto Sardelli, video projections, artistic workshops, sculpture workshop for the blind, visually impaired and sighted, sessions de pittura en plein air, sessions of Artificial Intelligence, performances, creation of three works of art.
home.paragraph2: The initiatives are open to citizens and especially to pilgrims, offering a real moment of reflection and participation beyond easy stereotypes. Promotion of active citizenship and social inclusion: The project involves local communities in cultural activities, such as artistic workshops in schools, public video projections near aqueducts, painting and Artificial Intelligence sessions in symbolic places of the territory, and the creation of works that variously interpret the theme of water. Enhancement of the territory: Municipalities VII and V, rich in cultural associations and artists' studios, will be at the center of a dialogue between artists, institutions, and communities, with the aim of strengthening the cultural identity of the territory and attracting residents and pilgrims of the Jubilee 2025.
home.paragraph3: The collection and management of public data will be carried out with criteria of transparency, providing verifiable data on the social, cultural, and environmental impact; optimization of resources, using technological tools and advanced methodologies to maximize monitoring effectiveness; accountability, documenting the results achieved to ensure clear and replicable reporting. The goal is to stimulate collective participation, enhancing cultural heritage and creating opportunities for exchange between different social and cultural realities.

appointment1.name1: Meeting/study day on Don Roberto Sardelli
appointment1.description: Meeting/ day of studies on the figure of Don Roberto Sardelli in the studio of the artist who creates a work in his memory. Don Roberto Rardelli was a key priest for the rescue of the living conditions of the inhabitants of the happy herd and aqueduct. Don Sardelli arrived at the end of the sixties in this degraded area of rome, dealing concretely with the inconveniences of the baraccati, giving life to a deeply innovative school and activating the water supply.
appointment1.artistList:
Artist: ALFREDO PIRRI, author of the work
Curator: ADRIANA POLVERONI
Study day speakers: ASCANIO CELESTINI, author and actor
MASSIMILIANO FIORUCCI, rector of Roma Tre University
ALFREDO PIRRI, artist
ADRIANA POLVERONI, professor at NABA and curator
VANESSA ROGHI, historian of school and education
Target audience: children, adults, everyone
Free access

appointment6.name: The Beauty of Water
appointment6.time1:
Art Work: The Mist Fountain by Paolo Assenza
Opening on 02 July and 31 October 2025 at 7.00 PM
appointment6.time2:
Art Work: Imago Acquae-Urbis by Mercedes Klausner
Opening on 02 July and 31 July 2025 at 7.00 PM
appointment6.time3:
Art Work: Ri-Sorgente by Laurent le Deunff
Opening on 03 Ottobre e 30 Ottobre 2025 at 7.00 PM
appointment6.description:
Creation of works themed on water and its sustainability.
Paolo Assenza's work consists of a fountain that activates during the night hours by capturing water particles present in the air humidity, which drip through the hole onto the stone element at its base. Constantly falling on the base, it modifies the appearance of the surface over time.
Artist Mercedes Klausner, hosted in residence by the Pianobi project, will create a work using dust obtained from the debris of old destroyed houses, recovered at the foot of the Felice aqueduct. This intervention will result in works capable of producing images that will be projected onto the walls of the Pianobi project at via dei ciceri 99.
Laurent le Deunff, during his residency at the Pianobi operational headquarters, will create a zoomorphic fountain. The work will be accessible to a diverse audience of professionals and non-professionals, including pilgrims who have come to Rome for the Jubilee. Visitors will be invited to express their personal wish through the ritual gesture of throwing one of the created coins into the fountain.
appointment6.artistList:
Artists: PAOLO ASSENZA
MERCEDES KLAUSNER
LAURENT LE DEUNFF
Curators: ADRIANA POLVERONI, ISABELLA VALENTE
Target audience: children, adults, everyone
Free access
